availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, riverboat captain. North Carolina native. Married to Mary Frances Littrell Varble in 1852. Father of Mary C. Varble, Nelson L. Varble, Pinkney Varble, Jr., Melvin D. Varble. Falls pilot in Louisville in 1860 and 1870. Owned and captained steamboats which transported troops and supplies during the Civil War.

ab.bibl:
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 8th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1888), 919-20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 124.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 4, p. 20.
Find A Grave, "Daniel Pinkney "Pink" Varble (1828-1892)," Memorial #84250064, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84250064 (accessed October 26, 2017).
“Reminiscences of Capt. "Pink" Varble,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), August 8, 1897, p. A6.
